intro: Cheirolophus, commonly known as the star of Bethlehem, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and features showy, often violet or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plants typically have hairy, linear leaves and produce small, dry fruits called cypsela. They are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Cheirolophus species are valued for their ornamental appeal and historical significance in herbal medicine.
